summary_points: 1. Damien Harmon, Best Buy's Senior Executive Vice President of Channel & Customer Experiences & Enterprise Services, resigned on July 18, 2025.
2. Best Buy will not be filling Harmon's position; instead, his responsibilities will be absorbed by the CEO and other executives.
3. Upon his departure, Mr. Harmon will receive separation benefits in accordance with the company's ERISA plan.
1. During the June 2025 quarter, treasury shares were withheld for tax payments at a weighted average price of $47.23 per share.
2.  Compared to the same period in 2024, consolidated operating revenue increased by $282 million to $30,688 million in the first six months of 2025.
3. Capital expenditures totaled $1.308 billion for the six months ending June 30, 2025, a slight increase compared to the same period in 2024.
1. AvalonBay Communities, Inc. closed a public offering of $400,000,000 principal amount of 5.000% Senior Notes due 2035 on July 10, 2025.
2. The net proceeds from the note sale, after deducting underwriting discounts and estimated offering expenses, are estimated to be approximately $393.9 million.
3. AvalonBay intends to use the net proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes, including potential land acquisitions and community development.
1. As of May 25, 2025, Walmart, Inc. and its affiliates accounted for approximately 29% of consolidated net sales, a significant impact on the Grocery & Snacks and Refrigerated & Frozen segments.
2. Foreign net sales totaled approximately $987.9 million in fiscal year 2025.
3.  Walmart, Inc. and its affiliates accounted for approximately 16% of consolidated net receivables as of May 25, 2025.
1. EQT Corp. expects a $720 million total gain on derivatives for the three months ending June 30, 2025.
2.  For the three months ended June 30, 2025, EQT expects net cash settlements paid on derivatives to be $(101) million.
3. The figures in this 8-K filing are preliminary and subject to change; final amounts will be reported in the Form 10-Q for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, or in the corresponding earnings release.
1. As of June 30, 2025, Invesco Ltd.'s preliminary assets under management (AUM) totaled $2,001.4 billion, a 3.0% increase from the previous month.
2.  Favorable market returns contributed a $58 billion increase to AUM in June 2025.
3.  Invesco Ltd. experienced net long-term inflows of $8.3 billion in June 2025, offset by non-management fee earning net outflows of $1.5 billion and money market net outflows of $10.6 billion.
1. Diamondback Energy, Inc. reported average realized unhedged oil prices of $63.23 per barrel, $0.88 per Mcf of natural gas, and $18.13 per barrel of NGLs for the second quarter of 2025.
2. The company anticipates a net loss on derivative instruments of $197 million for the second quarter of 2025, including a $52 million realized loss from early interest rate swap termination.
3. Diamondback plans to exclude the partial hedge termination from its second quarter return of capital calculation.
